definitions.definition: The act of exchange of an asset of lesser liquidity with a more liquid one, such as cash .
The selling of the assets of a business as part of the process of dissolving the business.
examples: The store is having a liquidation sale: everything must go as they go out of business.

main_definition: The act of exchange of an asset of lesser liquidity with a more liquid one, such as cash .
secondary_definitions: The selling of the assets of a business as part of the process of dissolving the business.
